as you selected other, could you please: Most likely a Linux Forum. I can't honestly remember. I'm a Linux enthusiast and I had it on a floppy disk. It was likely before 2006.
how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: I use TiddlyWiki for thought streams. I don't use it frequently, but it helps me map out my thoughts when I do use it. I have also demonstrated TiddlyWiki to friends and colleagues who find it helpful. Some have even gone on to use it more than I have.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: My use is basic; I use TiddlyWiki in a configuration close to standard, without plugins
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism)
how do you back up/sync changes between: No automatic sync across my devices
what are we doing well? prompts for thin:
TBH - I still run across TiddlyWiki files from when I first started using it (classic) - and they still work. So, I do not doubt that I can continue using it in the future. Some of my toddlers are new (v5) and I expect them to work as well.
Once I first figured out TW, it just clicked. I never became very involved in the community. But I may start looking into developing customization - not sure what, yet.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
Although I've used TW for many years, I'm just starting to look into the community. In my opinion, from what I can tell, things are good.
The only reason I would stop using TW is if it became dependent on some technology that I do not have access to.
Everyone that I've introduced to TW was also blown away by the capability and simplicity. So no issues.
Thanks!
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
